name: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on International Drive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayted here for new years! We loved it! The room wasn'y huge but perfect size for us. It was clean, up to date and had a nice screened in balcony. We were located in the very last building near the more so privatepool.
reviews.title: Loved it so much!! affordable and beautiful!
So relaxing . . .
reviews.text: It was a nice quite area and not a far walk from the main pool maybe 5-10 minuites. If you didn't want to walk they had a service that if you called they would pick you up on golf carts! the staff was awesome and wiling to help! We were only ten to 15 minuites from epcot and universal, seaworld was right down the road, about a 3 minuites drive. It was a perfect location for us. you only paid 800$ for a week!! We would deffinetly go back. The pools were beautiful as well as the landscape!

After searching the endless possibilities for lodging in and around Orlando, we chose the HGVC and we are so glad we did! We were in town for a cheerleading competition in Disney and were traveling with a young child. We got a great rate of $119/nite. The hotel is situated on a quiet part of International Drive, in an area where there seems to be some new resorts being built. It is adjacent to an outlet mall that you can walk to easily. In addition to the food court at the mall, there is a supermarket and a couple of restaurants across the street. We were tired each day after watching cheerleading and doing the parks, so we just ordered food at the convenient pool bar and relaxed while our child enjoyed the beautiful pool. The room had a fullly equipped kitchen, and if we return we will plan better and do some of our own cooking. One night they showed a kid's movie right next to the pool - our child was in heaven! The room was very spacious, beautiful, very clean, and furnished very nicely. We had a one bedroom unit with a king bed in the bedroom and a full sized pullout in the living room. If you had more people in your group additional bedding might be a problem as there are no rooms with more than one bed. (There was plenty of room for a rollaway , but I don't know if they have them.) Everything looked brand new. We were in building #2 which was the perfect location - very close to the pool without being exposed to the noise. Some of the other buildings are located across a body of water, connected to the rest of the resort with a dock- like walkway. I would not prefer those locations - it's not a really long walk, but we liked being close to the main part of the hotel. There is a pizza place and deli right on property. We had no trouble parking. We never waited for an elevator. The place was immaculate. The staff was friendly. The location was a short drive to Disney and Sea World. We loved everything about this place!
reviews.title: relaxation and sun in luxury!

reviews.text: I was treated by friends to a five day stay at this resort.This was my first visit to Florida. The apartment was beautiful,well appointed and spotlessly clean. The hot tub on rthe complex was an added bonus. February is an ideal time to visit,hopefully I will be able to do again!
reviews.title: best resort ever

reviews.text: We pulled into the grand vacation club on the 8th of march and from the moment I steped out of the vehicle I was in love with the place. The front desk staff is helpfull, the main lobby is beautiful. When we got to our room I was more than pleased. we stayed in a one bedroom whirlpool suite and it was beautiful. We had a large kitchen and everything was so clean. We traveled with 2 children and My husband and I and we had more than enough room. The pool is awsome. there is 2 pools. the bar was great to hang at while we were down at the pool and the food was great. overall I would return and I'am already considering going back soon.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a terrible time here a year ago and returned this year for the two free nights we were given as a result of the poor service. I am happy to say that the customer service was greatly improved! We had a wonderful short stay here the second time. This is an excellent location for families in close proximity to all the major theme parks. They also offer a lot of activities to keep kids interested. The new outlet mall right next door is great for teens. There is a path right to it from the resort.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: We just returned from a family vacation to Disney, spending 4 nights at the Hilton. Overall this was a pretty fantastic place for our needs. The hotel's grounds & pool are beautiful and well-maintained. I booked a package through orbitz and got a great rate. After a mix-up with my room, which was supposed to be next to my family, I was upgraded for free to a 1 bedroom suite which was absolutely HUGE and gorgeous--full kitchen & dining area, huge bathroom with jacuzzi and large separate shower, screened in porch. Also arrived around 11am, and they had the room ready to go--impressive. The studio rooms are also nice, but the suite really made the stay and would definitely be worth the extra expense, especially for families. Maid service and amenities were excellent. We were in one of the buildings at the end of the property, by a smaller pool, but a bit of a walk across a bridge over the lake to the main area. We didn't mind, but could be an issue for the older folks. On the plus side, we were located directly next to the gate for the huge outlet mall across the street, which was really a great place to shop. Ate at the food court there a couple times--good selection and fairly cheap for a resort area. There is also an Outback and some fast food within walking distance across the street. The large pool area was also a beautiful area to relax in at the end of the day, ate at the poolside restraunt a couple times which was pretty good. Had movies by the pool some nights.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Overall

reviews.text: The one main negative of our trip was the rudeness of the time share presenter that my parents experienced. They originally booked their room with a (slightly) reduced rate in exchange for attending a 2 hour time share presentation. After acting like their best friend and pressuring them to stay longer, my parents declined to immediately decide to pay the $37,000 time share buy in (not to mention maintence fees, etc). The presenter was extremely rude--shoved his chair back from the table, abruptly jumped up and loudly announced, "This presentation is OVER." Come on--how many people actually agree to spend that much money without thinking it over? It kind of ruined the first day for my mom--she just couldn't get over how rude he was. The ironic part was that they actually are interested in purchasing a vacation home or time share, but it sure won't be from Hilton. Finally called and caught me the next day, trying to offer discount Disney tickets, etc--got a big NO.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort!!!!

reviews.text: Other than that, the staff was extremely pleasant, going out of their way to be friendly. My husband and I typically stay at Marriott resorts, and I was favorably impressed in this regard with the Hilton.
reviews.title: really was easy to walk to outlet mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing to keep in mind for those who don't want to rent a car, is that the shuttle service ($6/pp round trip to Epcot, from there you take a bus or monorail to Disney or MGM, AK) only runs 3 times in the morning, and 3 returns starting at 6pm in the evening. Takes about 15 minutes to get there. From what we heard, cabs cost about $30 one way. Worked out okay for us, and the shuttle company seemed to be well-run. Cab fare from the airport is about $45-50, with Mears shuttle being $20pp.
reviews.title: Nice hotel could not deliver on basic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mother and I stayed here in March of 2007 for five days. We are annual Disney vacationers and have stayed at many places. During this trip we stayed at HGVC in one-bedroom unit and were extremely pleased.
reviews.title: I LOVE It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About us - We love Disney (hey I'm named after the Mouse), but we steer clear of Disney resorts. She is a single and active Senior Citizen. I am a single, 30-something. We go to Orlando to shop, eat, and play.
reviews.title: Fully lived up to expectations

reviews.text: Initial Thoughts - The location has gated security. This was very important to us. We wanted to make sure that our car was reasonably secure. The site is relatively large and there is no such thing as 100 percent safe, but we weren't afraid by our surroundings. In addition, we were directly located behind the Premium Outlet Mall and across the street from Publix. The grounds were pristine and well maintained. The only thing is that, after the parks closed, the parking was a nightmare. We did find parking, but still...It was a nightmare. LOL
reviews.title: fanstastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In - The line was a little long, but we were able to use the Hilton card for express check-in.
reviews.title: A Picture Perfect Paradise

reviews.text: The Room - The unit was very clean and had all of the necessary amenitities (kitchen and bath). The appliances worked and were clean. We were not afraid to eat off with the utensils and plates. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. It was very quiet. We didn't hear a thing.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week here in March and fell in love with the place. From the moment we checked in we were made to feel like we were family. The staff are only brilliant, they could not do enough for us. The one bedroom apartment we stayed in was beautiful, far too big for just two people and very well apointed with a fully equiped kitchen. The grounds are only glorious and the pool area is one of the most spectacular we have ever seen. The only gripe we had about this lovely place was that there were not enough parking spaces outside each block which meant you had to park outside the main reception area which is about a 10 minute walk from the farthest block. This annoyed us a little at the start of our vacation here but once again the staff came up trumps because they have a couple of minibuses and golf carts on hand to give you a ride to your apartment, no matter what time of night you turned up at ! We loved this place so much that we have already booked to go back again in October this year.
reviews.title: A Truly Grand Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for our stay. It was 5 minutes to SeaWorld and 10 minutes to Disney attractions and was conveniently located on International Drive. The hotel was beautiful. We stayed in a studio room that was plenty large enough for the two of us, with a screened in patio. The main pool was huge and all the kids there loved it, we also had a smaller pool right next to our room and was used more by the adults. All the employees at the resort were so friendly and helpful. Only thing to complain about was the prices of the food/drinks, little expensive, but you will find that at every place in Orlando.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: Background
reviews.title: Beautiful place and so convenient
Nice place
reviews.text: We are a family of 5. We have 16, 13, and a 6 year old. We have been to many locations in the United States and the Caribbean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Will Stay Somewhere Else my Next Trip to Orlando

aka: Hilton Grand Vacations Suites On International Drive Hotel Orlando
description: A beautiful family resort, Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on International Drive is just minutes to Orlando's world famous attractions including Walt Disney World®, Universal Orlando®, SeaWorld® Orlando, Aquatica® and is adjacent to Orlando Premium Outlets® - Vineland Ave. Guests of Hilton Grand Vacations Suites on International Drive enjoy a remarkable family vacation experience from the elegantly appointed studios, one and two-bedroom suites to the abundant resort activities. Hotel views include fabulous swimming pools, water features and a bird's eye view of the lush 34-acre resort grounds inspired by the beauty and ambiance of Tuscany.
